Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Doug S
Reviews.Content: We booked on-line during off-season. We got a really good off-season rate! Not sure of what to expect but was pleasantly surprised. Our booking was accurate and they were expecting us. Rate was what we booked. Hotel was small, clean, and easy to find with their directions on the website. Yes - rooms were small but -hey- this Venice and you're not paying very much! This is not a 5 star hotel and if you know that already - then you will be pleased. Please don't expect 5-star service like bell-hops or people waiting on you. The breakfast was really filling: quite enjoyed them! Juices, cereals, yoghurts, fresh buns, meat, cheese, etc - very nice - even with table linens and linen napkins! Only drawback was that in our room, the mattress was quite firm and found it tough to fall asleep - otherwise...I will stay there again!! Front staff were very friendly and could speak passable English. Best kept secret in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “pantalon”
Reviews.Author: jenny t
Reviews.Content: I stayed at hotel Pantalon during Carnival time for two nights. When we called to the hotel for having information about the direction for arriving, Erica helped us with her personally direction and in 15 minutes we arrived from the Railway Station. During the check in she gave a map and show us on the map the most important monuments and museums to visit. Room was a little bit small but traditional with pretty decor. Breakfast was good and also the waitress was very helpful, she has prepared a very good hot chocolate. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel Thank you, I will come back to Hotel Pantalon next time.

Reviews.Title: “just dont stay there !!!”
Reviews.Author: chrispack
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 3 nights was the most awful hotel ever stayed in worse than "fawlty towers"as the saying go's. The bathroom and bedroom you could not" swing a cat in", went to breakfast two mornings and both mornings had a chipped cup .The stairs was filthy and not been hoovered, really in need of a bit of love and tender care. The only good thing about it was the location which was great

Reviews.Title: “Average Service”
Reviews.Author: CATE666
Reviews.Content: Not help with the bags to the roms. NOT SERVICE MIND.

Reviews.Title: “Very low value for your money.”
Reviews.Author: hadidas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pantalon for 2 nights over Easter and payed a whopping 200 Euro per night. We are usually lower class travelers, frequenting (nice) hostels and budget hotels, but due to our late plans and lack of available rental cars, we had to take the cheapest option in Venice (other available options were 300+ Euros). For the price, and according to the reviews, we at least expected a nice hotel. The location is not bad, a short walk from a waterbus station and in a central area with an abundance of restaurants and bars. As most (probably all) Venice hotels, it is in a tight and very old building without an elevator, which could be expected. The room was tiny with hardly any room to open your suitcase, but even that was expected. Our complaints come from the rest of the amenities/facilities. Starting with the cleanliness, the room was way under par. There were cobwebs on the lamps, it was dusty, and there was a bar of soap (not far) under the bed. The bathroom wasn't cleaned well on the second morning of our stay. Even the sheets were less than perfectly cleaned. The bathroom was spacey (almost as big as the rest of the room) but there was no shower curtain, so taking a shower flooded the floor. At first there was no water pressure, because the hose from the faucet to the showerhead had numerous holes. After complaining, it was changed, fixing the pressure problem, but it should have been done before we came in. I'll remark that this is a 5 euro hose, nothing fancy, and it was obviously broken long before but never replaced. The bathroom problems continued the second morning when after showering we found out we were given tiny towels instead of regular bath towels like we were given the day before. There was a television in the room - actually a computer monitor - but there was no remote control and I was unable to turn it on manually, making me suspect that it too was dysfunctional. Being in Venice we didn't need tv, so I didn't complain to the receptionist. The beds were two singles pushed together with separate sheets and douvets. They were on wheels and so separated when lying in the middle. "luckily", the room was too small to have the gap wide enough to fall into :). And then comes the breakfast. It was horrid. Terrible coffee (in Italy!). You actually had to pay an extra 3-4 euros for an egg! The night before we payed 65 Euros in Verona (hotel brandoli) and had a great breakfast. Why can't they at least match the quality when charging over 3 times as much? I forgot to mention that the ancient plumbing meant you had to wait 2-3 minutes between toilet flushes. We complained about this and were told that that's how it is in Venice. The staff was okay. The lady there on the first night was nice and recommended places to eat, etc. But the guy there on the second night was very unhelpful. To summarize-choose a different hotel when staying in Venice. This place would have been acceptable at 50 euros a night, but for 200 euros this was a dump!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Pantalon is a disaster -a health disaster! Do not stay there!”
Reviews.Author: workaway26
Reviews.Content: My work sent me to Venice for a week, and the hotel seemed nice from the photos and suited the budget allowance. I read some negative reviews about the small room sizes but was positive to not let this ruin any free time around work, that I may have. HOWEVER- the reviews failed to mention the following points which I had to endure during the weeks stay and feel it essential to mention the following: 1- Fleas in the bed- I was eaten alive during the night and woke up almost every hour itching. I thought perhaps it was in my mind but my legs and arms and tummy have the bite marks and red swells to prove it. It was not mosquitos either because the bites were different and I wascareful to not leave windows open etc. 2- Ants all over the floor- there were a large number of ants coming through the cracks in the walls at the base of the wall where it meets the floor. I couldnt walk around the room without rolling my trousers up. Nothing could be left on the floor i.e suitcase because there were so many everywhere. 3- the staff were very unfriendly and unhelpful-despite what other reviews say 4- I have travelled a fair bit, and I have never been to a hotel where you are not allowed to take the room key out with you. every time you leave the hotel the staff ask you to leave the key with them. Ok fair enough thats their rules, BUT I returned one day to find there was no one on the reception or door, AND all the room keys had been left on the side within easy reach of anyone passing by wanting to raid the rooms and steal items. It was a security nightmare and I did not appreciate this. 5- NOT ONCE was my room cleaned, despite the fact I did see cleaning staff everyday. I asked them to clean my room , but all they did was "make the bed" in a fashion. They did not change the bed sheets ALL week, or provide clean towels or toilet rolls. I had to raid their cupboard which was near my room to get clean towels. 6-The hotel is located in the back alleys which are lovely to explore during the daytime but as a female traveller I did not feel safe when it got dark. There were lots of fights and arguments between the locals during the evening as the hotel is not in the main tourist strip. The noise is echoed by the alley location. 7- There is no lift and no one helped with bags (although this is not a major issue compared with the other points) 8-The rooms are very small. I was lucky in that sense as I could at least walk around my bed, but another English couple could not. They stayed just one night but because I had paid for the week up front, I was stuck. 9-There was a terrible smell from the hallway and breakfast areas which to me smelt like wet dogs. Pets are allowed in this hotel so bare this in mind when visiting. Overall the experience was dirty and a complete waste of money. I am not a stuck up traveller by any means, but this was certainly not average standard. It served a purpose and is cheaper than most places, but if cheap equals fleas, ants and rudeness, I would have preferred to pay a little bit more! The only positive point is that it isnt far from the bus station and the continental breakfast is edible. Take into account everything before visiting this place. Photos to come.

Reviews.Title: “Excellant Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: enjoylife010
Reviews.Content: The Pantalon is situated within two minutes of the water ferries operating the Grand canal, a must for sightseers..(San Toma terminal).We had our bedroom cleaned and fresh towels daily.The continental breakfast was good with the option of an extra "pay for" menu.The dinning room like the hotel was small and quaint with very helpful staff.The safe was even free for a small refundable deposit.Restaurants and bars in abundance nearby. The downside....you can sometimes hear people making their way home at night from bars, but I reckon thats the same in most quarters.Our bathroom was small,having to place your feet in the shower when on the loo,so if your fussy, book elsewhere,but we`d go back here again,in fact we intend too. We travelled Ryan Air,coached it to Venice no problem.However, arriving in darkness and having to walk across Venice to the hotel (as no motor transport ie Taxis) was daunting,but safe.Please get hold of a LARGE MAP prior to leaving,its a MUST,everyone gets lost through the maze of alleys and walkways that is Venice.Another tip....when leaving by coach,unlike on arrival(paying on the coach), you must get a coach ticket.This is not from their main office in the square, but across the road at the ATVO office.Another tip...dont book a hotel out of city area,you`ll take too long getting in and out each day.We are so pleased we picked Pantalon.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel, central Venice”
Reviews.Author: Kathy186302
Reviews.Content: My first solo trip, but any anxieties I had were soon dispelled by the warm welcome. Erika on reception was very helpful, as was her colleague, another kind lady. I booked a single room but instead of the usual broom cupboard at the back, I had a front room, over the street, with a balcony and french window. Pure magic !! A pizza 'take away' just yards from hotel, amazing food made to order, and at 2 euros a portion - unbeatable value. Dorsoduro is the student area and a residential district. Lovely to walk in and fine at night - I never felt threatened. There is a great roof garden. No good in winter, but would be a good place to rest in summer.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you might think”
Reviews.Author: cappuccino22
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location looks a bit out of the way but is easy to reach from the train and bus stations. It is actually on one of the main routes to Piazza Roma so there is signposting and plenty of shops and restaurants nearby. Our room slept three and was furnished in delightful Venetian style. The only downers were the lack of hot water after 9am, the smell of tobacco smoke and the thin walls / noisy beds... Breakfast was okay with a pay extra a la carte menu if you so desired. After checking out we were able to return in the afternoon to wait for our coach and use the nicely kept toilets. With the deal from Asda Hotels this was hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “would never stay there again”
Reviews.Author: rodCork
Reviews.Content: the paint in the bedroom was peeling from the wall. the blanket on the bed was badly in need of a wash.if you weren't down early for breakfast most of the food was not replaced. the staff were very helpful which is the only nice thing i have to say about staying in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Mihai64
Reviews.Content: The Pantalon Hotel is a very nice and elegant hotel. Me and my fiance were very pleased with this hotel. When we arrived the receptionist (his name is Liviu) smiled to us. Liviu helped us with informations all the time and he was really nice. The breakfast was delicious and the staff as well. The hotel is located very close to Piazza Le Roma,so you don't need to carry your luggage to much We will be coming back. Thank you for everything. Mihai & Adina

Reviews.Title: “I would not stay here if I were you!! Buyer beware!”
Reviews.Author: Bissell1
Reviews.Content: Hotel Pantalon is in a good location in Venice, however our room was not very nice at all. The beds were hard, the bathroom was so small you could barely turn around in it let alone use the toilet. When using the toilet, the only place for your feet to rest was in the shower. The toilet, shower and bodet were so close together, when you showered, the entire bathroom got wet. There was no shower curtain either in a stand up type shower. So, the beds were hard and the shutters on the windows allowed mosquitos to enter so you got bit in your sleep. This room did have a safe for your valuables and closet space to store your clothes. It also had a mini bar with semi reasonable prices. The breakfast was decent each morning so that was a plus. The front desk staff was very helpful when one of us came down with an illness and needed to see a medic. She called the doctor and got us right in so we are most appreciative of that. All in all this hotel was better than the ones we stayed in, in Rome and Florence but I was looking for something much better. We booked our trip through STA Travel and all rooms were paid for up front and non refundable so we sucked it up and stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of ground floor Momolo room far away from the hotel”
Reviews.Author: YUNATONI
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Momolo room, which is a 15 min walk from the hotel, you can't do it if you have luggage. I don't know why it is called a suite, it is a dark musty basement on the ground floor - in Venice people do not live on the ground floor. Granted it is cheap, but why spoil the experience of visiting a beautiful city when for little extra you can get something much more decent. Truly awful!

Reviews.Title: “A classic Venetian traveller hotel”
Reviews.Author: Edjamro
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through an on-line tour company. The place is a real gem. I had a single room with a shared secon floor balcony right on the street, but the double-paned french door and window blocked out all the noise when closed. I don't know how effective that will be in warm weather; there is no air conditioner. The room was relatively spacious and well laid out. It was beautifully decorated in the Venetian style (blue with gold accents and a Murano glass chandelier). The hotel is well located and comparatively easy to find for Venice, and the staff is very helpful. The vaporetto is nearby, but be warned, the cost of vaporetto travel has become exorbitant! A single ride is 6.50 euro = 9.10 dollars and it only gets more and more over-priced. Bring your walking shoes.

Reviews.Title: “Great littleplace, clean, fine location, but is low on hot water”
Reviews.Author: pansburg
Reviews.Content: Small rooms, but very clean. Nice staff. But the hot water was definitely lacking--I had the best luck at night getting a warmish shower. Still would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “No Hot Water!”
Reviews.Author: arizona_8
Reviews.Content: My main complaint about this hotel was that there was no hot water. Major turn off. I don't care how clean it was or how nice the people at the front desk were, just plain and simple, there was NO hot water. The room was clean, but small. The breakfast was average as was the staff. They pretty much ignored us on our last morning there when I needed directions to the train station because they were arguing with each other. Then the lady gave me bad directions and we missed our train. Big let down!

Reviews.Title: “Paid way too much, to put feet in shower when sitting on the toilet”
Reviews.Author: We4luv2go
Reviews.Content: The bathroom was so small. To get to the toilet or shower, you have to snake your way around the sink, then around the bidet, then side step to the toilet. To sit on the toilet you must put your feet in the shower. I couldn't believe we paid $345 a night for this room. Boy, did we get ripped off! The room was way too warm and since the air conditioning didn't work or was turned off for the fall, we had to open the window for air. As our room opened to the front of the hotel so we didn't get any sleep. The clomping noise of people walking on the board covered street out front was just too much. A room for 4, is just and extra bed squeezed into a triple room. The hotel has no elevator and no rooms on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel spoilt by circumstances”
Reviews.Author: m50lws
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was very good but some niggles let it down. The roof terrace was locked and not accessible and one of the waitresses at breakfast was a little unfriendly, whilst the rest of the staff were very helpful. At the time of our stay the path outside the Hotel was being re-laid by the authorities and the path had been replaced by boarding which echoed through the Hotel and in particular rooms at the front. I would dispute the time of one minute from San Toma but even so not too far. Wi-Fi access was fast and good signal strength. Stairs are a little narrow and steep and would not suit severely disabled.

Reviews.Title: “Customer Service DOES NOT exist at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelWithoutAMap
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hotel Pantalon on September 28th. When my friend and I checked in we were told the rate was 140 euro, which quickly dropped down to 100, and we finally got down to 80. We asked if it was two twin beds and if it was 24 hours. The lady said yes. When we came back later, it was a totally different case. We came back with our friends and were told that the hotel was closing up for the night. If our friends wanted to stay over it cost us an extra 20 euro after a 45 minute yelling match with the owner and the boss next door. The next morning we were rudely called at 6 AM and had another "conversation" with the owner. Bottom Line, we were lied to, harassed, and had to pay 100 euros for a hotel that had less charm than a trucker motel. The room was small, bare, and the pillow had blood on it. The only Venetian thing about it was the chandelier. The bathroom was ill designed, no shower curtain, no circulating air, and everything was crammed. Venice itself is beautiful, romantic, mysterious, absolutely wonderful. The staff at Hotel Pantalon were rude, course, extortionate, and put a big damper on our vacation. After we left, we all agreed that it would've been more enjoyable to have slept in the car. Save your money, do not stay at this "3 star" motel. If the owner of this establishment ever reads this (which I doubt he will seeing as the term "customer service" is not in his vocabulary) please refund my money, at this point that is the only thing that could at all salvage my view of this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Cramped, Noisy, Impersonal and Indifferent to Guests”
Reviews.Author: Rafarumba
Reviews.Content: Although it was easy to get to from the San Toma vaporetto station (only one bridge to cross with luggage), this hotel was on a narrow street under reconstruction, with a temporary board walk. Heavy traffic by students and others at all hours, so it sounded like horses galloping by while we tried to sleep. Hotel staff was indifferent, uncommunicative and no help at all. They always appeared or acted too busy to even look up as we came in & out. Breakfast was a joke; coffee from a percolator, some rolls, foil-wrapped cream cheese, yogurt, and imitation fruit juice. The room was very small and the shower had no curtain so it flooded the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “OK HOTEL - CLOSE TO WATER BUS & GOOD FOOD”
Reviews.Author: SANNS
Reviews.Content: My daughter (21) & I stayed at the Pantalon in October 2008, It was very close to the San Toma Vaporetto & when you eventually got your bearings,which is not easy in Venice, it is a very well positioned for sightseeing. The hotel was ok for the price - prepare yourself as Venice is a very expensive city & for what we payed we were not dissapointed. We had a room facing the street & this was ,I admit a bit noisy especially early in the mornings. We did close the shutters & that helped but unfortunately for us, it was a very warm October in Venice but the hotel turns off their airconditioning in September, so the room was a bit hot at night - no real biggie. Beds were a bit hard as the mattress was thin but still great after a day of lots of walking. The really funny thing was the bathroom, had all that was needed ,but to sit on the toilet you had to put your feet in the shower & when showering water went everywhere as there was no shower curtin, I found this very amusing, my daughter have lots of laughs over this bathroom. Other than that the room was small but quite ok, walls a little thin heard other people at times. There is no lift & the stairs a bit steep. Staff were really great, very helpful & friendly, even the breakfast lady who I am sure couldn't speak a word of English. Beakfast was breads tea/coffee/juice ham & cheese, & cereals, not heaps but enough to get you started. Around the Pantalon are some really great restaurants, we tried most & were not dissapointed with any, there is a little pizza place just a few doors up the street on the same side as the hotel that serves the best take away pizza & I am sure the cheapest water in Venice. a must try. Enerything is easy to find from here especially the water Bus Station. My daughter & I loved Venice, first day was frustrating as we got lost heaps but the next day we got the hang of it & we had an amazing time. Although it not the most luxurious hotel, if I was to visit to Venice again I would probably stay at the Pantalaon mainly due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location a little off the tourist track and reasonably affordable in a very expensive city.”
Reviews.Author: RockvilleMD
Reviews.Content: If you're going to Italy, remember that everything in Venice is much more expensive than in the other cities. So the same class hotel in Venice might run you close to double what you'd pay in other cities. This was certainly the case with the Pantalon, which while very nice, felt hard to justify the 190 EURO/night cost. The Pantalon is a very short walk from the San Toma Vaporetto stop which is served by the express (#2) line from the train station. YOU MUST, ABSOLUTELY MUST print off the map on the hotel's website if you want any chance of finding the hotel easily from the vaporetto stop. This is Venice, after all, so it's not because this hotel is any harder to find that any other place in the city. Everything in Venice can be difficult to locate! There is no elevator in the Pantalon (not unusual for Venice) and all of the rooms are located up a long, high flight of stairs. The rooms were extremely small, definitely the tiniest of any of the three hotels that we stayed in during our trip to Italy. We booked a quiet double, and while the room faced the interior, we still heard plenty of street sounds, so ear plugs are a must if you're a light sleeper. The bathroom was bare bones, with no shower curtain and pretty low water pressure. Just put a lot of towels down and you'll be fine. The key to the in-room safe and the remote control to the television could be had for a 20 EURO deposit. Breakfast was a selection of juices, cereal, and cold rolls with a variety of spreads. For a few extra EUROs, if you were so inclined, you could purchase a selection of various hot foods. The location of the hotel was fairly good. Venice as a whole is fairly tiny, although it can take a long time to walk from Point A to Point B because there are very few streets that are direct and unimpeded by a rio. It was about a 5-10 minute walk to the Rialto Bridge, about a 10-15 minute walk to Cannaregio (a great restaurant area), and about a 20 minute walk to St. Mark's Square. We enjoyed being slightly away from the central touristy areas, especially being there Easter Weekend. The staff were a mixed bag. The morning and nighttime desk clerks were fairly unfriendly but were helpful if you needed assistance. The afternoon clerk was excellent though, recommending some incredible places to eat that were definitely known and frequented primarily by locals, and giving us some shortcuts to help us navigate. All in all, you're going to pay a lot of money regardless to stay in Venice, and at the end of the day, I would recommend the Pantalon.

Reviews.Title: “Bang on for position and value for money”
Reviews.Author: josephine-public
Reviews.Content: We found the hotel very easily using the hotel's map. If you want a posh location, pay posh prices. This was exactly how I imagined it, down a little alley overlooking the neighbours windows. I could have shook the neighbour's hand as we smoked on the tiny balcony. This is real Venice. There is a church nearby and it does ring it's bells every day. Again, if you want to sleep away your time in Venice, that's up to you. The room was tiny but had everything we needed for a four day stay. Plenty of wardobe and drawer space. I don't go in for cat-swinging whilst on holiday. The only real problem was if one person is trying to enter or leave the bathroom whilst the other is stood at the wardrobe, but how much of a problem is that? The bathroom was funny as well. It had the obligatory bidet but everything got soaked as there was no shower curtain. It was obviously not designed to be a wet room but that was how the owners had it so no use worrying about the possible damage. I just spread all the towels around after I had finished with them and let them soak all the water up. The walls were paper thin but people did seem to realise this and kept the noise down. This will be the same just about everywhere in the world except airport hotels.The safe in the room was a laugh, I could open it with my nail, but, hey-ho, nothing got stolen. For those needing regular tea/coffee, take your own kettle and this will save you a fortune. There is a small food shop around the corner on the way to Sa Toma Vaporetto stop with a lovely Trattoria opposite. Sorted. This does exactly what it says on the tin. For those not wanting anything more than a clean and comfortable bed for the night, somewhere to shower, a light bite before facing the world, then this is it. The next time I go back to Venice, I will check this hotel's prices first.

Reviews.Title: “A genuine Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: SirPeder
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice with a friend in mid-June and wanted a centrally located, but still reasonably priced hotel, and decided to try the Hotel Pantalon - a decision we never regretted. The hotel is situated a short (and straight) walk south of the Piazzale Roma, where the airport express bus terminates. You have to look carefully to spot the hotel sign, as the building itself is an old Venetian townhouse which merges beautifully with its surroundings. Walking to Rialto or Accademia will take you 10-15 minutes at the most, and the neighbourhood provides lots of opportunities to explore and "get lost" in the narrow streets. As the rest of Venice, the area felt completely safe, even late at night. We occupied a room on the top (2nd) floor with a view of the rooftops and terraces nearby. The room was small, but charming, decorated in a charming and unmistakably Venetian style. Everything was clean and the towels were changed daily. The attendants spoke the necessary English and were always pleasant and willing to help. Breakfast - included in the price - was very satisfactory and was served in an intimate dining room just off the reception. I rate this hotel 'excellent' because the only drawbacks were traits common to all of Venice: mosqitoes and small rooms. Considering the price and marvellous location, I don't see how you could do much better than Hotel Pantalon, and I would definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Quiet but central location”
Reviews.Author: Kiblerfaeri
Reviews.Content: By far the best aspect of our stay was the hotel's location. Initially it looks like a hole in the wall, but there are tons of nice little restaurants up and down the street. Fantastic pizzeria down the street. The owners speak little to no English, but they managed and serve up fabulous pizza and gelato.Just a 5 minute walk from the San Toma vaporetto stop, it's easy to get to all the main attractions. Front desk personnel went above and beyond with all our questions and concerns. The breakfast was ok, nothing spectacular but decent. The room was small-ish, as was the bathroom. Pretty standard for Italy, but for those with American sensibilities it's a tight squeeze. No elevator, and no views to speak of if you manage a "balcony" (just the neighboring building and an alley below).

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: SinD1025
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with hotel. Sure it's no 4 or 5 star but it's in a great location. Just off the "St. Toma" stop on the vaporetto and a small walk. Great area to just "get lost". Night/Weekend Desk lady was AMAZINGLY nice! Breakfast wasn't bad, except the service lady had an attitude. Another fantastic part is a GREAT Pizzeria a couple spaces down with awesome food. We'd nightly get something to eat and head back to the hotel. Only bad things we experienced was the first night the water heater was broken so we had to take a shower with cold water. It was promptly fixed. No Shower curtain so it made a mess, and we had 1 bug visit us... we're still trying to figure out what it was!! Overall i'd definetly stay in the hotel again mostly because of the great location, awesome desk lady and great pizzeria and bakery just down from the hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Good base for walking central Venice”
Reviews.Author: DrJohn72
Reviews.Content: We know Venice well [10th visit] and had no difficulty finding the Pantalon - 13 min on foot from Piazzale Roma, with wheelie luggage-bags. Newcomers should probably take the vaporetto to San Toma - note that the express #82 stops there, as well as the "stopper" #1. Room comfortable enough, not small as some have complained; some headroom issues over the bed, as a result of being under the eaves, but a bonus of a view of the top of the Frari tower. Even better view from the roof terrace - key free on request. But it's true there is no shower curtain over the bath - so the floor gets wet no matter what - but that's their problem, it just uses up the towels, which were always changed. And it is a bath, unusual in Venice. Reception staff were consistently excellent. Breakfast basic but OK. Our main problem was a curious one - stale cigarette smell coming in through the aircon, only on the last 2 nights out of 4, so it wasn't the previous occupants. We didn't realise how bad it was until we unpacked at home and everything, clean or not, had to be washed. Asked about a cash discount, but there was none as we'd booked through Venere.com who obviously take a cut - so book direct if you want a cash discount.

HotelInfo.Name: Pantalon Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Dorsoduro 3941 | Crosera San Pantalon, 30123 Venice, Italy
